title: My TF SUCKS or at least has been sucking lately. Give me general TF advice

replies.body:
Rule #1: If you verse a Diana, just give up and turret hug.
Other: Unlock your camera and look for ganks - don't teleport poorly.
Get all the cs you can and spam blue card, not red.
You're safer to play it out and farm then spike with hat + lich.

im assuming your talking about tf mid?early game is tf's weakest. this is where most tf's make the mistake of trying to go toe to toe with there oppenent and end up feeding and getting flamed, get cs, sustain with blue card,pull a gold card stun enemy then immediately use wildcard then back off and repeat, use destiny to make a 3-4 man gank for top or bottom to get your kills early on. after that get a lichbane,boots and zhonyas then just stack ap items of your choice.

Hey,
It would be insanely hard to give you advice atm, as you have not provided us with any information about what role you play and what champ etc. However feel free to add me in game and we can watch a replay together and I will go as in depth as I can to give you advice. Most of the advice will be about positioning and understanding the enemies cool downs, but if you want specifics, choose a few replays. Looking forward to helping you!

Yours sincerely, 
Talwyn
TF= twisted fate, twisted is a mid laner.
Know when to roam, where to roam, what match-ups you can play aggressive in and what ones you just need to make sure you don't feed.

I ain't no TF expert but here are some places to start.

1. **Farm up.** Minions are worth more to you because of your passive so get as many as you can. Grab the small raptors too. Eventually you might pick up a small lead, maybe even if it's just a ward. It all helps. 
2. **Don't get pushed in past 6.** Within reason, push up your lane (put that extra ward money to use). If you're stuck defending your tower you can't walk out for half a second and pick up a cheeky kill elsewhere. I mean, you could try gank anyway but you'll probably lose tower and that's usually not worth it.
3.  **Check both sides of the road before you ult.** It's all well and good that you know where the enemy is but make sure at least someone on your team team is near to back you up if things go wrong. If you're still figuring out TF's 1v1 power this is decent precaution.

ayy a TF player like me. Yeah same with my I've been doing terrible playing Twisted Fate as well :(. I always watch this guy "Gross Gore" you probably already know him but I like watching his TF plays despite people saying how annoying Gross Gore is. If you don't know who he is, check him out.
